page.title: 16Wydon Farm at Haltwhistle.
page.content: My family have lived at Wydon Farm for over 200 years. We keep cattle and Swaledale sheep, because the soil is not good enough to grow corn. My grandad used to grow barley, but my dad grows grass for hay and silage to keep the stock alive in winter. He has a{Limousin bull}and{Angus cows}to sell beef cattle at Hexham and Carlisle marts. Two years ago he built a sheep house. He uses it to keep the mules in for the first half of the winter, then he puts the{Swaledale ewes}in at lambing time because it is easier to keep an eye on them than if they were up on the fell. This year my dad has 700 lambs. He will keep 35 and sell 665 at the marts in the autumn.
